item.title: Artificial Intelligence in Macao Culinary
item.description: "Macau's Opulent Fine Dining Scene is Using Ai to Tackle Sustainability: How Restaurants in Galaxy Macau, Sands China and Grand Lisbon Are Leading The Green March Forward." Amanda Sheppard Macao's cuisine scene, a region known for its vibrant mixture of Portuguese and Chinese influences, is taking its first steps in a technological revolution with the integration of Artificial Intelligence (IA). AI entered the world of cooking as a tool of efficiency and innovation. In Macao, a territory with a diverse culinary heritage, AI application may reshape traditional approaches to food. The fusion of advanced technology with rich culinary traditions creates a unique landscape, offering both opportunities and challenges. The historical background of the kitchen in Macau enhance the unique identity of the region. Macau was a Portuguese colony for over four centuries, creating an intricate mix of Asian and European culinary practices. This mixture formed a rich culinary tapestry, with dishes such as cod and minchi macanese to gain local and international fame. As we examine this story, we appreciate the unique features of Macao's kitchen, which AI technologies are now prepared to improve. In recent years, the growing adoption of AI technologies in the global gastronomic scene has marked a significant change. Restaurants began to use AI for various purposes, such as improving customer experience and rationalizing food preparation processes. AI -powered chatbots, for example, entered the world of food services, providing customers immediate assistance to navigate the menus, order, and make reservations. This technology eliminates linguistic barriers, allowing tourists and local inhabitants to get involved with culinary offers smoothly. In addition, the food preparation sector is watching the influence of robotics and intelligent equipment. AI algorithms can optimize cooking processes by analyzing data on ingredients, cooking times and consumer preferences. This data -based approach allows bosses to focus on creativity by minimizing the risks of human error. For example, Michelin restaurants such as Chief Tam Seasons, SJM's Robochon Au Dôme, Galaxy's Walk Kitchen and The Londoner's Churchill’s Table are all stimulating change and received praise for using AI to improve operational efficiency and maintain high food quality standards. Heads António Coelho, Sally Jimenez and Cristiano Tavares do Lisboeta study the introduction of AI into their culinary practices. Mizumi's chief André Chiang is making progress in the world of culinary with technology. Known for his innovative gastronomy approach, chief Chiang has taken advantage of AI in his culinary developments. Its Japanese restaurant at Wynn Macau uses smart technologies to improve traditional kitchen techniques. When using AI tools to analyze customer reactions and service standards, it can continually improve dining experience. The prospects for the role of AI in Macao cuisine range from the professionals of the sector. Some bosses adopt the integration of technology, facing it as a way of overcoming the boundaries of cooking. The supporters argue that AI can help maintain the cultural essence of Macaense food, while innovating with new flavors and presentation styles. By analyzing large amounts of culinary data, AI may suggest unique combinations of ingredients that could not occur to human heads. On the other hand, there are those who express concern about the potential loss of authenticity. Critics argue that trusting technology can harm traditional kitchen methods and the human touch that is an integral part of the culinary arts. Its point of view underlines the importance of preserving heritage and emotional links associated with handmade food. Despite these different perspectives, the thesis remains that AI's role in Macao's culinary industry can represent a fascinating evolution and not a substitution of human ability. (continues)

item.title: Hong Kong Budget for 2025-2026
item.description: Recently, the Hong Kong government presented its budget. In the fiscal year of 2024-2025, he obtained revenue of $ 559.6 billion of Hong Kong, the expense ascended at 754.8 billion, the actions issued reached 130 billion, debt reimburses were 22.1 billion, the fiscal deficit was 87.2 billion and fiscal reserves in 647.3 billion. Tax revenues have fallen 45 percent over the past six years. The tax deficit was due to the fall of taxes on the sale of unprofit and the continuous increase in spending on infrastructure, investments and health services. In the budget of 2025-2026, the Hong Kong government estimates that revenues reach 659.4 billion HKD, expenses are in the order of 822.3 billion, the actions issued reached 150 billion, debt reimbursement if they are 54.1 billion, the fiscal deficit of 67 billion and tax reserves reach 580.3 billion. To reduce the fiscal deficit to 67 billion, the government has proposed measures to increase revenue and reduce costs. To increase revenues, the main measures will be the increase in actions from 150 billion to 195 billion in a five -year period, with more than three and five years, mainly for long -term projects such as the North Metropolitan Area and for the payment of short -term debt. Another measure that is being considered is the application of “charging border fees to private cars that leave”, charging 200 hkd per car, although tourist buses and trucks are exempt from this rate. As for expenses, the government provides to lower them to 113.4 billion over the next few years, freezing the salaries of civil servants, and eliminating 10,000 jobs over the next two years, reviewing the “reduced rates of public transport to elderly and people with disabilities” and reducing funding to universities. After implementing these measures, the government expects to reach the budgetary equilibrium three years later, that is, in 2028-2029, standing in line with the precepts of the Hong Kong Basic Law that stipulates that it should be lived within the possibilities. Looking at the budget in its entirety, there are three points worthy of attention. The first is that tax reserves are insufficient to meet unexpected large expenses. Tax year expenses of 2024-2025 were 754.8 billion, but the current tax reserves are 647.3 billion. If the government has no revenues for a year, tax reserves are not enough to cover expenses. This also means that if there is an emergency that implies large expenses between 2025 and 2026, such as if the pandemic is active again, the government will have financial resources very limited to its disposal. The second is the non -existence of negative capital. In the fiscal year of 2025-2026, the revenues were 659.4 billion and the expense of 822.3 billion. The difference between revenues and expense was 162.9 billion, which represents 25 percent of the total expense. During this period, the government's main source of revenue from “personal taxes” and “profit taxes”, which reached about 301.2 billion. As the population of Hong Kong is gradually aging the government continues to cut into taxes to benefit people, and the amount of “personal taxes” and “profit taxes” will be reduced. Issuing actions is a way of contracting a loan. Although it can solve short -term tax problems and ensure that the government has sufficient cash flow, it does not solve the budget deficit problem and tax reserves will continue to decrease. In the long run, these two factors may affect Hong Kong Statute as an international financial center. The most viable way of resolving the budget deficit is to ensure that revenues are higher than expense. “Charging border rates to private cars that leave” can be an effective measure to increase government revenues while encouraging people to make their shopping in Hong Kong, which will undoubtedly help the city's economy. Of course this measure may have some impact on Hong Kong's integration into the Great Bay area. The third question is the number of measures to reduce expenses that can be taken. The government is thinking of freezing the salaries of civil servants, as well as eliminating some civil service jobs by reducing subsistence and social security expenses. As the population is aging, spending on subsistence benefits increase progressively and there is not much room for cuts in well-being benefits. In the long run, it may not be easy to get the goal of balance between revenue and expense by reducing government spending through austerity measures. With an aged population and expenses to increase, the financial problem will only get worse. To obtain the budget balance, the government will have to have stable and long -term fiscal recitas. A few years ago, the government studied the possibility of applying a "rate for land and sea departures", similar to the "collection of border fees to private cars that leave." However, as the “Terra and Mar Departures Rate” is calculated on a per capita base, with the number of Hong Kong cars traveling to the city, for city residents to shop in mainland China, this rate would bring considerable revenues to the Hong Kong government and encourage people to consume in the city by helping their economy. Another tax that was considered was the sales rate, a way to guarantee the government stable long -term revenues. According to a 2003 study, if the sales fee were 5 percent, the government would raise about 30 billion in tax revenues per year. With this tax, the fiscal deficit can be reduced. In addition, the government can impose higher rates on the highest and lower products on the first -need products, thus achieving the objective of wealth redistribution and reducing the moat between the poor and the rich. Looking at the budget in its entirety, if the government does not increase revenues it will not be able to meet the expenses. If this situation continues, it will easily exhaust the tax reserves. Therefore, only increasing revenues can gradually get out of a complicated financial situation. In addition, social progress and various measures to the welfare of the population require capital. If the financial problem is not resolved, governance will be difficult. item.title: FRC | World Poetry Day celebrated tomorrow with tertulia
item.description: This Friday takes place a session at the Rui Cunha Foundation that aims to celebrate poetry, such as what happens around the world. The initiative “give life to a poem”, coordinated by the doctor and author Shee Va, is a tertulia in which everyone is invited to bring poems to his choice and read them together, always in the discovery of words The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) presents tomorrow, from 6.30 pm, a special session to celebrate poetry. Tertulia calls itself “give life to a poem” and intends to celebrate World Poetry Day, a date instituted by UNESCO at the 30th General Conference in Paris in 1999, to honor the poetic expression and its cultural importance in societies around the world. The event is organized by the Book Friends Association in Macao and the Jardim da Flora Friends Poetry Association, and an opportunity to encourage reading, support poets and preserve linguistic and cultural diversity through the written and spoken word, ”describes the FRC. In the form of gathering, the public is invited to pass the FRC gallery with a poem of their choice, in Portuguese or Chinese, to share with the other participants, in a will be with the purpose of enriching the common experience. Poetry, with its ability to thrill, provoke reflections and convey feelings, crosses centuries and civilizations, being one of the pillars of literary art. Form of expression According to the FRC, "more than a simple set of verses, poetry is a manifestation of the human soul, which can be lyrical, epic, social, philosophical or experimental, adapting to different eras and styles." “From the sonnets of Camões and Liu Yong's classic poems to the free verses of contemporary poetry, this literary genre has been a powerful means of communication and resistance,” he adds. The session will be conducted by the doctor and writer Shee Va, representing the Association of Friends of the Book in Macau, who will invite participants to reveal poems with special meaning in their lives. The conversation will be held in Portuguese and Chinese, according to the suggested readings. Shee Va, a gastroenterologist and author of several books on Chinese culture, has been dedicated to various cultural initiatives, having integrated, in 2023, the IV Virtual Meeting of Lusophone Writers in Venezuela. In 2018, he launched a work on the opera in Macao, named “Opera at the end 18-Tome III”.

item.title: FRC presents “Law themes” by the end of the month
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) promotes today, tomorrow and then next week, on March 26 and 27, at 6.30 pm, a set of lectures on law topics, on the “vicissitudes of the process (I)”, which aims to identify possible incidents in the judicial proceedings and address the respective regimes. The sessions will take place in parallel, in the Portuguese and Chinese languages, coordinated by Teresa Leong. The sessions are organized by CRED-DM-Center for Reflection, Study and Dissemination of the FRC Macao Law. This cycle of conferences aims to address, in a practical and explanatory way, relevant daily topics of all Macao judicial operators, a project started in previous years and which had great adhesion of the class. According to Teresa Leong, "the judicial process begins with the dispute and ends with the decision to end this dispute." "If the process follows its normal course, without major starters, justice is naturally served without disorder. With “process vicissitudes (i)” begins this approach with the analysis of the circumstances in which it can, or has to modify the subjects of a judicial process and their implications for the ongoing process. In the first session, that is, today, it will speak of the “subjective modification: subjective substitution vs. subjective cumulation” and “third party intervention: main intervention”. In the second session, a week later, it will be the turn of the presentation of the module “Third Party Intervention: Accessory Intervention and Opposition”. The lectures in Portuguese are held today and on March 26, and the counterparts in Chinese are held tomorrow, 20, and March 27, at the FRC gallery.

item.title: FRC | Arte Gongbi, from Zou Li, to be seen until April 5
item.description:
“Burning Like a Lotus” is the name of the new exhibition patent at the Rui Cunha Foundation until April 5th. This is an opportunity to get to know the Gongbi Art Gender, with works by Zou Li. Gongbi Art is known for the extreme detail painting with fine brushes
Since this Tuesday there is a new show to visit in the Rui Cunha Foundation Gallery (FRC). This is “Burning Like a Lotus”, by artist Zou Li, which is an example of the Gongbi art genre, characterized by the use of the traditional thin and delicate brush technique, about Japanese rice role, silk fabric or oriental silk fans. Zou Li is considered "a renowned painter with more than fifty years of career and experience, whose artistic focus is mostly around themes related to the history of Chinese women." The three dozen works now exhibited at the HRF were held between 1997 and 2022. In the artist's work there is a “awareness of femininity through his extraordinary artistic expression”, being present in the creations “harmonious and moving of the beauty of the body and soul of women”, according to a FRC note, Ung Si Meng, honorary president of the Association for Friendship and Coordination of former Macao's Chinese Popular Advisory Conference. It is also described that "for a long time, and to fulfill his social responsibilities and his vocation as a professional painter, Zou Li actively participated in several important historical creations." It is the scroll roll entitled “Imperatriz Wu Zetian” or the “Hundred Chinese Concubin Images” collection. Ung Si Meng also described Zou Li as "widely recognized and appreciated by experts, academics, colleagues and the Chinese artistic society." Large Also according to the same note, it refers that Zou Li's works “reflect the dimension of his academic and artistic knowledge, which have already attracted the wide attention of national and international artistic circles”. In addition, "his works have been much appreciated by art galleries, museums, art institutions, public and private, and collectors." Zou Li has created, throughout his career, more than a thousand works, as well as more than fifty individual exhibitions, in his country and abroad, having also published more than ten individual art catalogs. Recently, in April 2024, the National Museum of Women and Children of China acquired a collection of 593 of his pieces. Zou Li is a member of the China Artists Association, a researcher at the Wenshi Research Hall of the Guangdong Popular Government, director of the Guangdong Province Institute of Chinese Painting and honorary president of the Foshan Artists Association. In the past, he performed the functions of deputy director of the southern branch of the China Central and History Institute of Culture and History, where he also did research work.

The reader will never find the names of the presidents in the book, being only referred to as “the president” and having all in common being a “source of the delay in Africa's development”. "We have had external interventions that surrounded the development of Africa, such as slavery, such as colonization. After we release these processes, came the dictators and they are clearly the source of disrespect for human rights, the source of delays, pile, crime. item.title: Climate | HK Observatory predicts up to eight typhoons this year
item.description:
The Hong Kong Observatory predicts that this year temperatures in the region will continue to increase due to the impact of climate change. Up to eight typhoons are also expected to pass within 500 kilometers from the city, which is about 65 kilometers from Macao, from June
The Hong Kong Observatory launched a 2025 forecast on Tuesday that points to higher temperatures due to the continuous impact of climate change. The entity that monitors the weather and climatic phenomena in the neighboring city, and is usually in line with Macao's weather and geophysical services, estimates that this year enter within 500 kilometers from the city to eight tropical cyclones, starting in June or even before. The meteorology agency also stated that Hong Kong will be affected by storms and strong and localized rain, although it predicts that annual precipitation is located within normal values. "Generally speaking, Hong Kong temperatures have recorded an upward trend in recent years. In fact, we have registered Hong Kong's highest wind temperature. It is the result of urbanization and also the effect of climate change," said Observatory Director Chan Pak-Wai, quoted by public broadcaster RTHK. The director of the Hong Kong Observatory pointed out that 2024 was the hottest year since there are global records and that in the region 11 months were registered with temperatures above the usual.
In mild heat According to the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) of MSAR, last year the average temperature in Macau was 23.6 degrees Celsius, 0.8 degrees above the medium values ​​climate, equaling the hottest year since there are records (2019). By the way, 2024 was a year of records at almost all meteorological levels, adding to the high temperatures, tropical storms and torrential rain. In the annual analysis of 2024, released in early January, SMG justified the most frequent occurrence of extreme phenomena and rising sea level with increasing temperature and ocean warming, representing a threat to coastal cities like Macao. Last year, April was a highlight as the hottest since April 1952, “with the average monthly temperature, the highest average monthly temperature and the lower average monthly temperature beaten all records, reaching the highest values ​​ever for the same period,” SMG say. In total, Macau registered last year 42 hot days, plus 10.7 compared to climate average values, 31.3 days.

item.title: Shenzhen | Registered incident at Ling's nuclear central to
item.description: Authorities announced the registration of an incident at the Ling Nuclear Center in Shenzhen, which had occurred on 27 November last year, when a chemical control system desalination box was left open after a replacement operation. The case was reported on Tuesday by the Unit Police services, which received a report from the Guangdong Province Nuclear Emergency Management Commission on the Nuclear Emergency Management Commission. "On November 27, 2024, during the process of replacing the delineation box of the chemical control system and volume of unit 1 of the Nuclear Ling Nuclear Central, the delineation box isolation valve was not closed as requested, causing the liquid level of the control tank to go down," was communicated, citing information from interior authorities. "The staff on the ground immediately suspended the operation, with the level of liquid of the stabilized control tank. During treatment, unit 1 maintained the operation safe and stable, presenting the parameters within normal, having not affected the safety of the central, its staff," he was added. The nuclear center classified the present occurrence on March 17 as a level 0 deviation event, and communicated to the national supervision and control entity. According to the International Nuclear Accident Scale (Ines), nuclear incidents are classified in a 1-7 school. For the interior authorities, level 0 is considered "as a deviation that is not included in Ines and is essentially for the correction of deviations and return of experiences."

item.title: Schools | New guidelines for the use of mobile phones
item.description:
Sheng Kung Hui Macau's social services received requests for help -related help from children between six to eight years old. DSEDJ will launch guidelines for next school year on the heights and circumstances in which students can use their mobile phone
The government will launch a set of guidelines on the use of mobile phones for students of non -higher education schools in the territory, which will take effect from the next school year. The measure was revealed yesterday by the head of the Secondary Education Division of the Directorate of Education and Youth Development Services (DESDJ), Leong I on, during the Macao Forum Program of the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. The official indicated that the guidelines will serve as a management guide, and a starting point for schools and parents to reach consensus, indicating the circumstances in which students can use their mobile phones, but limiting their use during classes and even intervals. To help schools move to the new reality, DSEDJ is committed to supporting schools to buy cabinets to store the appliances. In the same program, the head of DESDJ Curriculum Development and Evaluation Division, Cheang Sek Kit, recalled that the government spread among the schools in the territory instructions that should be included in the teaching system on good internet use. These instructions indicate that adequate and healthy use of the Internet by a young man should not exceed a daily average of one hour, with intervals of 20 in 20 minutes. The screen pacifier On the other hand, a representative of the social services of the Sheng Kung Hui (Macau) charity association has release to the public broadcaster microphones that internet addiction affects ever younger youths. Ho Ka Hong, social worker at the Anglican Church, linked the need to reinforce cyber literacy in schools and promote good use of technology among the young. "Our organization mostly accompanies young people aged 10 to 24 years addicted to the Internet. However, we have already received requests for help from parents due to excessive internet use by children aged between six and eight years," said the social worker. Ho Ka Hong recalled that in 2022, Sheng Kung Hui performed an inquiry into literacy on the Internet that it showed, unsurprisingly, that the mental state of young people deteriorates the time they spend online, with particular incidence for the use of social networks. "Young people are always aware of the notifications of their social networks, which can influence their emotions and cause anxiety," added the social worker.

item.title: Elections | José Cesário warns of CTT problems
item.description: José Cesário, Secretary of State for the Portuguese Communities, defended Radio Macau that the usual conditions in the operation of the elections in Portugal, namely the May 18 legislatures, will occur again due to the functioning of the CTT. For José Cesário, these system conditions will affect the electoral participation of the emigrated Portuguese. "The Assembly of the Republic has not produced any kind of legislative amendment that may be considered in a current electoral process. Therefore, if there is no change, the method will be exactly the same," said the official. In practice, the voter will continue to have to receive the voting report by the mail at the indicated address, then deliver it to the CTT. However, delays in the operation of services or other bureaucracies make it possible to receive the bulletin on time and hours, for example, generating potential increase in abstention. "We are fully aware that there are very varied difficulties in the domain of the functioning of the post office systems in various countries, and this is a difficult matter to overcome," he said. The Secretary of State hopes that the May Legislative Elections can take place "in the best way possible". "Unfortunately, I know very well that there are countries where the post office works will strongly limit electoral participation," he said. The problems are of various order and go through situations where "people, for various reasons, or have changed residence, or not voting in several successive elections, may not receive the vote." The Portuguese again go to elections on May 18 following the lead to the motion of confidence presented by Prime Minister Luís Montenegro, in the Assembly of the Republic, leading to the dissolution of Parliament.

item.title: World Games | Special Olympics Macau win four gold medals
item.description: The Special Olympics Macao Movement entourage has won 14 medals, including four gold at the Winter Games for people with intellectual disabilities in Italy. In a statement, the movement stressed that the entourage had only eight athletes, and “for most of them” was the first time they competed in the world winter games. This is because the latest edition of the competition, which was scheduled to take place in 2022 in Kazan, Russia, was initially postponed due to Covid - 12 pandemic and then canceled due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine. The star of the Macao entourage was the 18 -year -old Chio Hao Law, who won two gold medals on the 100 -meter and 200 meters of snow races. In September, Chio was Macao's first athlete to compete in the Paralympic Games, finally ending the length heel race for athletes with intellectual disabilities in Paris2024. Also in the Snow Race, 17 -year -old Huang Hou won a gold medal in the 200 meter race and one bronze in 100 meters. The other gold medal for Macao was for Sou Fai in the 500 -meter race in the speed skating. The 25 -year -old athlete also got a silver medal in the thousand meters race. In the dance modality, the territory won two bronze medals in the individual race and two more medals in the mixed peer race, thanks to Chang Chak Kuan, 19, and Lam Cheng I, 16. The Turin2025 Winter Games took place between 8 and 15 March, with the participation of more than two thousand athletes from 103 countries.

item.title: Real Estate | Room transactions go up. Down prices
item.description:
In February, 176 dwellings were purchased and sold at an average of 76,243 patacas per square meter. Compared to what was happening a year ago, prices suffered a 11.6 percent reduction, but 44 transactions were registered
Last month, the house price reduced 11.6 percent, compared to the same period, to an average of 76,243 patacas per square meter. The information was released by the Directorate of Finance Services (DSF). In February last year, the average price of the square meter of housing was 86,225 patacas, 9,982 patacas above the latest amounts released on Monday. However, when the comparison is between January and February this year, the average price of dwellings has a valuation of 6 percent, from 71,917 patacas per square meter to 76,243 patacas per square meter. At the price level, the reality is now different from what was happening in 2019. Before the pandemic, the average price per square meter was 98,618 patacas, which represents a reduction of 22.7 percent, or 22,375 patacas, compared to the data provided on Monday. The information about last month shows that Colaane was the most expensive area in the territory, with an average of 83.5 71 patacas per square meter. In the mud, the average price of the square meter was 82,471 patacas, and on the Macao peninsula of 72,986 patacas. Greater demand The highest price reduction seems to have resulted in an increase in the number of purchases and housing sales. In February, 176 transactions were reported, 44 more than in the same period, when 132 were accounted for, which means growth of one third. When the comparison is made between last month and January, there were 94 transactions, a break of 34.8 percent, from 270 purchases and sales to 176 transactions in February. However, in 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic, the market was more active than currently happens. In February 2019, 279 transactions were registered, 103 more than last month. However, in terms of the volume of transactions, February 2019 numbers approach the January registration this year. The latest data also reveals that the Macao Peninsula was the place with the most transactions, a total of 126 housing purchases and sales. In second place comes the mud with 36 transactions and coloane, where 14 purchases and housing sales were registered.

In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story." Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J.
